shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 2r-169vb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 2r-133v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 134r-146v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 147r-153r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 154ra-165ra) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 165ra-169vb)
Additiones 1-5.

donors.donor: Gäbrä Giwärgis is mentioned as the buyer of the Ms. in Additio 1. A few individuals are mentioned in supplication formulas written interlineally, at the beginning or at the end of a psalm, in black or red, in a secondary hand: Zä-Wäldä Maryam (fols. 90r, 134r), ʾabunä Fǝqurä Mikaʾel (fols. 37r, 83v, 120v), ʾabunä Wäldä Mikaʾel (fols. 9r, 17r, 61v, 127r), Gäbrä Giwärgis (fol. 146v), Wälättä Śǝllase (fols. 26r, 74r, 104r, 147r).

owners.owner: The name of the original owner has been erased from Additio 3.

dcomments.dcomment: 18th cent. (?) Quire A dates back to the 15th cent.

txstates.txstate: The back board is broken and repaired with strips of leather. The leather cover is missing. Its remains are loosely inserted into the Ms. Traces of adhesive are visible on the inner side of both boards. Many fols. are stained with wax. Fols. 7, 143-6, 149 are torn apart along the ruling lines. Holes and tears amended on fols. 2, 51, 103, 104, 149, 151, 152, 161.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

txfolios.txfolio: Two leaves have been foliated as number 142. The second leaf has been given the number 142a.

squires.squire:
{A(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 8 of quire I/fol. 1r-v)} – I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XIII(9; s.l.: 4, stub before 5; 5, stub after 3; 7; stub after 2/fols. 98r-106v) – XIV(8/fols. 107r-114v) – XV(8/fols. 115r-122v) – XVI(8/fols. 123r-130v) – XVII(8/fols. 131r-138v) – XVIII(8/fols. 139r-146v) – XIX(8/fols. 147r-153v) – XX(8/fols. 154r-161v) – XXI(8/fols. 162r-169v) – B(2/fols. 170r-171v).
Quire A (fol. 1, stub after fol. 9), inserted sideways, originates from an older codex.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2 and I-3: all data for fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4 and I-5: all data for fol. 155r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Numeral ፮ “six” looks like compressed numeral ፯ “seven” )fols. 4v, 68v, .

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; incipits and numbers of Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters of Ps. 118; refrains of Text I-4 (occassionally abbreviated); elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-2; two groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-4; two lines (alternating with a black line) of the incipit of teh daily readings of Text I-4.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ስ፡, ስቡ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ (Canticle 10) Text I-4 ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ እ᎓ , እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ Text I-5 ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት

additional.cont: Fol. 1r-v: Excerpt from Sinodos “Senodos”.
additional.det: The fol. has been used as a quard leaf (quire A). It originates from an older Ms. containing “Senodos”, fol. 1r: canons 4-7, fol. 1v: canons 10-14; cf. AM-002, fols. 99ra-100rb.

The note is written in a poor hand. The name of Gäbrä Giwärgis, the buyer of the Ms., has been written in the same which added interlineally the supplication formulas. Most probably he is not the original owner of the Ms.

additional.cont: Fol. 153v: Excerpt from 1 Jn. 1.
additional.det: The note is written in a very crude hand. Possibly it is a writing exercise of a certain Zä-Wäldä Maryam.

additional.cont: Fol. 169vb: Ownership note.
additional.det: The note is written in the main hand. The name of the owner has been erased.

additional.cont: Fols. 170ra-171rb: Yǝweddǝsǝwwa mälaʿǝkt “The Angels praise Her...”
additional.det: The prayer has been written in a mediocre hand some time after the main text. The initial line and the name of St. Mary are rubricated.

extras.extra: - The title of the Ms. ዳዊት is written, in paint, on the outer face of the front board. - The internal number of the monastic library (344) is written on fol. 1r. - The midpoint of the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 76) is marked on fol. 68v. - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: e.g., fols. 2r, 3r, 5r, 7r, 17v, 21v, 36r, 76r, 77r, 107v, 117v, 142ar, 144v. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 21v, 22v, 31v, 87v, 102v, 107v, 116v, 126v, 135r, 142r. - Part of the line is taken down: fol. 89v. - Tämälläs-sign indicating where the omission belongs: fol. 152r l.15. - Omitted words and passages are written interlineally and in the margins, in the main hand and in a secondary hand: fols. 2r, 32r, 39r, 40r, 40v, 41r, 58v, 67v, 68r, 87r, 89r, 90v, 91v, 100r, 104r, 117r, 125r, 142ar, 148v, 149rv, 150rv, 151r, 152r, 153r. - Corrections over erasures, in the main and in secondary hands: fols. 15r, 52r, 66v, 109v, 110r, 114r, 142r. - Text I-3 contains numerous corrections. - Erasures: 32r, 52v. - Pen trials: fol. 82r. - Scribbling, doodles: fols. 2r, 81v, 89v, 90r, 99r, 113v, 115v, 137v, 143r, 171rb, 170v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: The title of Ps. 101 ጸሎተ፡ ባሕታዊ is written in the upper margin of fol. 90r.

frames.frame: Fol. 2r (incipit of Text I-1): simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. Fol. 90r: simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. Fol. 134r (incipit of Text I-2): simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
